website_summaries.verdict: The Mirror is an interactive fitness device that's like having your own private gym. With thousands of classes to choose from, you can exercise in the comfort of your home without sacrificing a lot of space.
pros: Thousands of live and on-demand classes for all fitness levels

customer_reviews.title: 2 units in 14 months have died.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return one of these after the pump failed after about 3 months and the seller would only replace not refund as I had thrown the box away. Now after about 7 months since the second one also failed, and managed to fry my PSU in the process. I will RMA this now as its out of warranty from the seller. The worst thing about this problem is there is no warning signs, no rattle, no vibration, no noise. The pump just stops, the CPU heats up and the machine cuts out (if you are lucky) Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: fishbaby73

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler, Pre-Applied Thermal Paste, Pretty Quiet... for the most part!
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU cooler for my Intel i7-7700K build... does what it says on the tin. CAM software is pretty decent. For all of you silent PC wannabes, pump and fans are fine on silent mode but when you start to rack up the speed of the fans beyond 50% you start to hear them vividly, pump @ 100% still can’t be heard tho, well in my build anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Delorie

customer_reviews.title: Great item with a G12 bracket, Let down a bit with the software.
customer_reviews.text: Great item, I am using it with a Kraken G12 bracket on my 1080ti keeps temps around 24-27 currently at idle and 40-46 at load, However the CAM software sometimes does not start up when my PC does even when I have told the software to do so, Sometimes I forget to check if it has started up when my PC has and when I play a game (PUBG) sometimes it rockets up to 80c and crashes the game because the fans and pump are not on.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly 🙏
customer_reviews.text: Was slightly worried from some reviews I saw of leakage but after installing it, works great! Upgrading this PC part by part so the Ryzen 2600 was hitting 50ish Celcius on the stock cooler and well over 80 when under load (usually top 85). With this installed it idles around 23-25 Celcius and barely hits 55 Celcius under load 🙏 the bracket installing was fine, came with everything needed, only thing I'll say for a first time installer like I was, i would have liked the brackets to be labelled or packaged like the thumb screws were with amd.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Caution with screws and instructions
customer_reviews.text: While the cooler looks amazing, I had 2 issueso installation: 1. One of the thumb screws broke during installation. After checking online, this has happened to a number of people and I imagine that as a result of one side being looser than the others, the cooling seems uneven and not as good as advertised. 2. The instructions on which screws to use where were unclear and as such, I pierced my radiator when attaching it. Again, a quick google search showed that I was not alone in this problem, this was frightingly common in fact. Though it doesn't affect performance in any noticable way, it's a terrible flaw in the instructions to not be clear on this.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel Frohlich

customer_reviews.title: Lighting effect stopped working
customer_reviews.text: The lighting effect stopped working and worked with NZXT online over a week to try fix the issue which didnt resolve the issue and was told it was a software isse that would be resolved in the future to which I then asked for a link to the software I had that it did work with which I was then told that wasnt an option. So what they are saying is they are selling coolers with software that doesnt work with it? other than that the unit seemed to work great but I expect better service than being fobbed off so I wont use their products again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robb

customer_reviews.title: Damage was very minor and it works great! (Warehouse deal)
customer_reviews.text: Was told item had damage, hence the much lower price (like £50/60 cheaper) from Amazon Warehouse. Had a deep scratch on the radiator mounting point (so unnoticeable on installation) and a couple of light scratches on the pump itself. For the fact it was £50 cheaper, I'm not complaining at all! Installation was super easy for me on an AM4 socket. The screws for the rad/fans are domed however and make putting my case panel on somewhat difficult (Thermaltake Core V21). Other than that, brilliant AIO, that reduced my temps massively. Going to uninstall this weekend and replace the paste with some Thermal Grizzly Conductonaut and see if I can get even lower than my current 35*C idle temps.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot B.

customer_reviews.title: beautiful cooler, but had 2 pumps fail
customer_reviews.text: Cooler is by far one of, if not the best looking AIO you can get. However, in less than a year i've had 2 pumps fail on me. Decided not to try a third time with NZXT and have gone to Corsair to try out the H110i which is louder and i think is giving me higher (by maybe 2c) idle temps compared to the Kraken x62 That said, i'd rather have a louder, uglier, pretty much the same performing cooler as long as it doesn't randomly fail.
customer_reviews.author: Klowdie

customer_reviews.title: A Beautiful AIO, and quite effective
customer_reviews.text: i have been really impressed with this AIO i was attracted to the infinity mirror on the pump and the integration with the NZXT software has many many customisable options. the operation under normal conditions is quiet and keeps my cpu at a steady 30 degrees idle, Now i have pushed this 240mm AIO as far is it can go by still using it with a 9900k, the temperatures on a 5Ghz all core overclock still keeps the temperatures on non AVX loads reasonable around 70 degrees gaming. i am very impressed with this NZXT AIO cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Works well! Slightly overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Good AIO for your COU or GPU if you are using a G12. Noise levels are acceptable but it definitely needs a human tune of the fan ramp speed. Or else you can hear it ramping up and down. Looks good, does the job well. Still, a bit expensive for it's use. Also doesn't save your settings on the device, you need to keep that usb cable in or it just reverts to a rainbow.
customer_reviews.author: Resv

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance, not worth the premium price!
customer_reviews.text: Lowered my temperatures by about 10 degrees under load but the glass logo came scratched and scratched even more with light whiping with a micro fibre cloth. NZXT are aware coolers are supposed to be re-seated and taken out every so often but any touching of the screen and you will leave a mark! £140 for something that marks that easy is a plain rip off. (Photos attached)
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: A nice piece of tech that works efficiently.
customer_reviews.text: Delighted with this cpu water cooler. It’s pretty straightforward to install didn’t really have any problems with that. The 360mm fans run quieter than I was expecting even when being pushed hard. The cooler head looks fantastic with the rgb lights and can be modified with the NZXT cam software. In short a very happy purchase. Would recommend and it’s not over priced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Mc Dermott

customer_reviews.title: Beauty and the Beast.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two Kraken x62 in two different builds and can’t fault their cooling ability. The Krakens beautiful aesthetics only cements my love of this product. By far the most attractive cooler for any rig. I previously had used the Corsair H115i pro 280mm but the thermals are definitely better with the NZXT Kraken x62.
customer_reviews.author: Weasel-in-Jeans

customer_reviews.title: Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: The NZXT Cam software is a joke. Bought this to cool a ryzen 3800x. The ryzen utility was reading the cpu temps as about 30 degrees idle and would very under load. But the Cam software was consitantly reading temps about 20 degrees higher. Which means even under a light load the aio would ramp the fans up to 100% which was loud. And that is if the Cam software even detected the aio was connected. And why does the software require an internet connection? Wish I had stayed with corsair. Returning this and replacing with a corsair aio.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Booth

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Looks great and build quality is good, software is a bit naff and takes a bit of tweaking to get fan and pumps right for your system. I would suggest putting a decent thermal paste on instead of the pre applied as I have dropped another 4 degrees after doing this.
customer_reviews.author: manor

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, loads loads of colour options, very quiet and works well
customer_reviews.text: This is the first liquid cooler I have installed. It looks amazing and has such a huge array of colours and settings to make your system look cool! It’s very quiet even under heavy loads. Playing the new modern warfare the CPU (i7 9700k) temp was between 50 and 60 deg. The software is easy to use too, as I have the NZXT 510i case the pre-installed lighting is controlled too via the software . However with this case my MSI 2080TI trio touched the fans so I had to place them to the back - which actually makes it look neater too! Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Mooreski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooling!
customer_reviews.text: I love the nzxt kraken x62 on idle it has my cpu at around 24c while gaming if thats vr/squad/very high demand on cpu its around 35/45c which is awesome if you want to update ur cpu cooling i highly recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: ooooh its so nice
customer_reviews.text: this is a beast pure and simple, keeps my Ryzen 5 cool and looks pretty whilst you do it...software is CAM and works fine for me, lots of choice on colour schemes but mostly it does its job, its easy to install and comes with brackets for AMD and INTEL so ready to go out the box... definite recommend from me... has to be one of the nicest looking ones you can buy
customer_reviews.author: p millard

customer_reviews.title: Great AIO, check for damage on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Some find on the realist or were bent on arrival, the packaging box was dirty on arrival. But the product itself is fantastic, I have replaced the included fans with Aer RGB and the CAM software, a little tricky to log in, is otherwise a great package. The rgb is my favourite of all AIOs and the build quality other than the arrival state is otherwise fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: James2011

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU cooler. It's my first water cooler so I don't have much experience with them but from what I've experienced so far, it works well and keeps my i9-9900k cool. The app that controls the rgb lighting is pretty intuitive and also monitors the usage, not to mention the rgb lighting on it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Kondas

customer_reviews.title: This AIO is very good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This AIO is very good for the money, build quality is superb and cooling performance is excellent. But not without its flaws. The unit is connected to the main CPU fan header on the board and set to 100% in the bios and included fans were connected to the included splitter. The pump was making a very annoying ticking/vibration during post and windows install, it only went away after installing CAM, the moment the program was installed the pump went super quiet, I set the pump speed to a fixed 100% inside of CAM and turned off the LED's. The proprietary CAM software is horrible, luckily it saves settings to the device itself so after setup you can uninstall cam.
customer_reviews.author: Ronan

customer_reviews.title: Cooling is very good
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this AIO cooler to replace my H100i V2 as it was on its downfall and hitting really high temps. It is really easy to install, looks amazing and performs really well. I stress tested my i7 7700k for 10 minutes and the max temp it reached was 64c, I also benchmarked and played GTA 5 and didn't get about 60c on it so I am extremely pleased. For the noise level is it fairly quiet but can get loud on the higher rpms, nothing you'll notice while gaming though, I don't use the stock fans that come with it though I use noctuas nf f12 industrial ippc 2000pwm.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for cooling and the looks the part too!
customer_reviews.text: Best cooler I’ve ever used! Easy to install and really keeps temperature down, I was hitting nearly 80* on my CPU before. Used my PC last night and max I hit was 43*. Genuinely worth every penny! Not forgetting how good it looks and the ability to adjust colours on NZXT Cam software it really looks the part
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyDanST172

customer_reviews.title: No proper am4 support. Bad product.
customer_reviews.text: In product details in clearly states that am4 socket is supported however product came without am4 bracket, instead it came with this silly "amd" universal bracket. Installation was extremely bothersome. Pump makes audible flowing water noise. Nzxt cam software is pure rubbish. Won't even work. After couple hours I must say that I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Malinowski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome temps whilst looking awesome ;)
customer_reviews.text: What a great looking pump and RGB setup. Have had corsair AIO before and must say this NZXT unit is seriously good looking. But it doesnt stop there.....i7 4790k at 4.6ghz idle in summer temps at 37 deg and load at 72 deg (using thermal grizzly kryonaught paste). Only downside is that the wonderful RGB logo cannot be rotated to correct readable orientation if you mount the pump any other rotation...my RAM sticks up too far and hits the pump barbs..... No hesitation to reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: CSingh

customer_reviews.title: Get it together NZXT
customer_reviews.text: Whilst it looks and runs great, the software is just terrible. CAM which you are forced to use doesn't even work right now due to authorisation problems which mean I can't control the fans or RGB. When it does work, they datamine your computer without your consent, you can't even use the software without being connected to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Beaaautiful
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but so beautiful I really can't complain. Quiet and deadly, my 9700k doesn't ever go above 65... and ultra silent too! Epic
customer_reviews.author: Edu Pimentel

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: Built my first PC, bought the kraken X62 to cool my I7-9700K, performance wise does a brilliant job, idles at 20-30 (my room gets super hot) and has never rose to a concerning temp during any game so no complaints there, however the CAM software has to be by far the worst software I've ever used, the application itself constantly freezes, won't detect the cooler which is the only component I installed it for, and so I'm unable to customise the rgb mirror or have any control over the fans/pump whatsoever, I also haven't been able to find any other software to do this so I'm stuck with how it is
customer_reviews.author: Robert S.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bit over priced for what it is but it knocked 30-40 degrees off my cpu temps (i5 2500k) which will certainly extend its life. The CAM software that comes with it is pretty basic it very functional when it comes to lighting on the cooling system and fan control also has a good temp and usage panel for gpu and cpu which is handy I would defiantly recommend this cooler to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Tifftots93

customer_reviews.title: 5* Product Let Down By Software
customer_reviews.text: The Kraken X62 is fantastic at cooling and a gorgeous looking product. Bringing my temps down by 20 Degrees from my original CPU fan. Idle temps around 33C and 70C at heavy load using RealBench on a 4.8GHz i5-7600k. The product is fairly easy to install for the PC enthusiast and first time builders alike. The instructions are easy to follow and simple. The CAM software to change the colour and animations on the Kraken is touch and go. Sometimes it will work and more often than not it won’t. Uninstalling CAM and rebooting your PC will fix this issue however.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: What a waste!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the look of this cooler and since I have many other NZXT products, I felt sure that I would be getting a great quality cooler. Well I was wrong! Right out of the box the RGB ring did not work most of the time and when it did, it was barely visible. After weeks of troubleshooting with NZXT support and purchasing extra cables and even a USB hub, I now have no RGB lighting at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Much better...
customer_reviews.text: I had a few reservations about purchasing this item as my previous one was a strange shape plus one of the legs didn't quite reach the end of the bed also,it made a grinding noise that was a little disconcerting.This one however came without legs and was a much more regular size and i am much happier with the noise this one makes....
customer_reviews.author: Steve 'O'

customer_reviews.title: Maybe the best AIO water cooler.
customer_reviews.text: The Kraken X62 is well designed and easily installed. Performance is excellent even with fans at 25%. The CAM software can be used to set the fan and pump speeds. CAM also controls the RGB lighting on the pump and will even put a FPS counter on your screen whilst playing games. The device can also be used without CAM but the USB cable must be plugged in to power the RGB light. This is an impressive contender in the AIO cooler market and well worth purchasing if your case can take the 280mm radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pump is too loud and the Fans could be better.
customer_reviews.text: You are essentially paying for the looks. It's quite loud and the pump and fanspeeds are only controlled by the CAM software which means that you can't configure anything in your BIOS. The cooling performance ist quite good but this is not a great achievement considering the rad size and noise. It looks great though, maybe the most beautiful AIO design available atm. I'll return mine and just use a Noctua since I don't really care about how it looks.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Looks striking. The RGB modes are amazing. It’s next to silent and keeps my CPU very cool. The only thing that bugged me is the lights stay at default settting until Windows is loaded but it’s not a big deal. CAM software is a little buggy but not as bad as some people say it is. Very well built.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bate

customer_reviews.title: Best !
customer_reviews.text: If this cooler turns out to be as reliable and trustworthy as a much loved (still running) Kraken X60 I'll be more than happy. For now it works perfectly. Good temps both at idle and under load, looks amazing. NZXT did a super job with the X60 - X62 though could be nothing short of perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Hubs

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bit of kit, make sure you have a case big enough, I have a large mid ATX case and my ram just about touches the rad with a pull configuration as a push config wouldn't have worked, not too loud and keeps my 3600 really cool under load with a 10% OC at about 40-60 degrees. Can be a pain to fit another pair of hands could come in handy but I managed, just take your time with it. The NZXT software is also very nice and colours on the mirror are also gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Billy Van-Der-Have

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, but it was worth my money
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install, clear instructions. I used an air cooler for my i7 7700k and my temps were insanely high. While gaming (Sea of Thieves or A Way Out etc.) it sometimes went as high as 82+ degrees, now some people said it's ok, these processors tend to go high but I did not accept that.. I wanted to get my temps down, so I thought about 2 things, buying the new i7 8000 series with a new mobo or try an AIO solution. After lot of research, I decided to get this one and I was amazed. My temps went below 50 degrees while playing the same games, that is around 25-30 degrees colder than it was before.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Romhanyi

customer_reviews.title: Why sell hardware with custom software, if its not going to work ?
customer_reviews.text: The cooler overall was super easy to install, its very pretty and quiet too. However the software (CAM) that comes with it and is required to be used, is buggy, often does not work between boots and is generally a pain in the arse. Having to go through many hoops to install custom software to interact with the cooler is not what I'd consider a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my new PC build, easy to use out of the box. Provides a sturdy product that is easy to install and it is providing great results with my CPU great thermals, no matter how hard I push it. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Borham

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a Noctua NH-U14S. The difference between this & air cooling is that I can run the fans at low, at all times, and the PWM sensor will never spin them up as the radiator has so much heat soak capacity! A stellar buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ciarán P.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded the fan that came with my i7-7700 to this, and honestly it's a great choice. The CPU cooler is extrremely quiet and easy to install. The only con I would say is that the tubes are quite stiff, but it could be the way I installed the radiator. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Liam W.

customer_reviews.title: My third kraken AIO
customer_reviews.text: This is third build I've used a Kraken AIO and never had one fail in the past 6 years. This one was a clean and simple install and the software is greatly improved from earlier releases. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: onyx.online

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Changed from an Arctic Freezer 34 to this, CPU temps dropped 10 degrees at full load on the same test maxed 58 degrees. Runs very quietly pump/fans etc. Software works OK for me but it seems to have major trend of issues with a lot of people. Overall really pleased
customer_reviews.author: nc3450

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a 280mm AIO then look no further
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and aesthetically decent. Good build quality and lots of options using CAM Software to alter RGB, if that's your thing. As far as thermals go this is as good as any others that are comparible on the market. I also own a Corsair Hydro H115i and this is just as good on thermal performance and looks nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Agazon

customer_reviews.title: Keeps CPU very cool, near inaudible.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install.. I chose to use my own Corsair 140mm fans instead of using the included NZXT fans so i can't speak for them. Having the 280mm radiator allows for a less aggressive fan curve which reduces acoustics massively. I plan on purchasing another on in the near future for my GPU (alongside the Kraken G12 mount).
customer_reviews.author: Dion

customer_reviews.title: CAM can be better but I actually don't find it too bad as ...
customer_reviews.text: No problems with this AIO what so ever. Keeps my non-delidded i7 8700k at 5gh within 72C when at full load (voltage is at 1.344). CAM can be better but I actually don't find it too bad as it has not crashed, lagged nor has it lost it's settings. Not much difference cooling wise between this and the X62 to be honest so save your cash.
customer_reviews.author: Stoycho

customer_reviews.title: Tricky but worth it
customer_reviews.text: looks the dogs B and runs nicely, I did kind of put the pump on upside down lol so make sure the pipes are facing towards the front of your pc. There is a set of instructions inside that walk you through the setup for intel and amd which I thought was very useful. well worth the money especially when the heatsink compound is already applied to make it easy for you.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sweetman

customer_reviews.title: Best AIO I've used
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooler so much I bought a second one. Have one on my CPU, one on my GPU and my system is so cool and silent even under load. My favourite cooler by far and looks great too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead twice
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, I've had 2 of these, and both haved died. The first lasting around a month, the next one lasting around 2 weeks and just overheated my cpu. Very good looking cooler, shame...That's about the only thing goid I have to say about it. No luck.
customer_reviews.author: ExileKnight91

customer_reviews.title: Would never buy again
customer_reviews.text: Ran at decently low temps for about an hour Fans locked on 100% which is a known bug with this water AIO It was so noisey that it was unusable Cooled no better than a Noctua twin tower cooler which I reverted to
customer_reviews.author: LLIAM MCCARRON

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I like the infinity mirror and the cooler performance. I don't like the software bugs and the fans that started to make noise after 1 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rog

customer_reviews.title: Warning
customer_reviews.text: Honestly do not buy this. I've gone from a corsair AIO water cooler to this, and the issues I've had are unbelievable. I'm not talking about setting the thing up (which is fine) or the horrendous buggy software, I'm talking about genuine issues with this coolers performance. It looks good, but nothing is worth this devices performance issues. Please just trust me. I'm throwing this in the bin and getting a old school fan and metal cooler (seriously).
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: its a KRAKEN aio cooler
customer_reviews.text: really good performance and looks from this cooler temps are well within where i want and matched with all the other nzxt products all syncs flawless
customer_reviews.author: Mr. A. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: What a dream!
customer_reviews.text: Built this pc on sunday and what a dream it was to use the nzxt aio cooler. Keeps cpu at a very low temp and works great! Overall, no krakling noise and works great!
customer_reviews.author: ItzNicks

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler, looks awesome too
customer_reviews.text: CAM software is much better than some of the reviews have mentioned, I really like it, loads of options and very useful. The cooler itself is pretty effective, keeps my Ryzen 1700 at about 33 Degree Celsius while playing games such as PUBG, Squad, GTA,, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: Using it for couple of years now - still going strong. No coile whine, great cooling with 7 years of warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Czcina

customer_reviews.title: Low CPU Temps
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my 8700k temperatures in check. I have two Noctua NF-Ps as oppsed to the default fans that come with it. Note if you use said fans make sure in the software to change the minium RPMs else they won't spin. Software gets better each update.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Looks fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with my new cooler, only took about half hour to install and wire up. Worked straight away, software works great aswell. Looks great in the case, noise isn't that noticeable when you're playing games and it does a great job of keeping the temps down. Definitely recommend this 👍
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Terry

customer_reviews.title: No thermal paste
customer_reviews.text: Great product however mine came with no thermal paste on it and dust and dirt where the paste should have been (was I sent a used one?) Anyway good product if it was as described.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: got on sale great value
customer_reviews.text: nice and quiet and keeps my32 core threadripper under 70 deg cel at all times. even when it draws 500w.
customer_reviews.author: andrew breckill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooler.
customer_reviews.text: This cooler looks great and the performance is AMAZING. It might cost a lot but honestly i think it was worth every penny. It is running at 24 °C at idle and around 34-36 °C at load on my i7 8700k which is overclocked to 4.7 ghz. Many people said that the cam software needs improvement but honestly its fine. I'm really pleased with this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: louise bailey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing...
customer_reviews.text: Got it cheap, looks sexy af. Cools my Ryzen 7 3700X to about 30 degrees at idle, 55 - 60 - 70 degrees depending on the game. First time builder and it was pretty easy to install, no hiccups with the cooler! Love it, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: wup_

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, perfect price. Have had no problems with this as I was a bit nervous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pump didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Cooler installed easily, drew power and ran the fans, but the water pump just would not work. I contacted NZXT support, who were very helpful and suggested lots of potential solutions, but ultimately they couldn't offer a fix. I am now returning for an alternative product. Rating two stars simply because support tried so hard to help.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: It does wwhat I need it to do and some. OC'd a Ryzen 9 3900X to 4.35GHz and didn't break a sweat. Fans look a bit pants but they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Metin Ismail

customer_reviews.title: Great performance from cooler. I need new mini usb I can’t find
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Turns out the whole problem was with the mini usb to 4pin cable, but I cant seem to find this anywhere so NZXT, better get one sent as yours is faulty! Now I have a long mini usb to 2.0 powering it. Keeps my i5 6400 at 30 or below after hours of gaming with 99% cpu load which is more than better imo so I’m pleased with that. However the Cam is quite useless as you can’t actually set any colors, only option is the constant white flush.
customer_reviews.author: AKern

customer_reviews.title: high quality
customer_reviews.text: the best computer fan i have had, quiet beautiful and do the job keeps my cpu in a nice temp.
customer_reviews.author: douglas

customer_reviews.title: Cooling or noise
customer_reviews.text: The fans noisy compared to noctua fans. Cooling performance is very good Indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs W Lam

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Temps are down and PC is nice and quiet. What more can you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Willard

customer_reviews.title: Top quality cooling system
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooling system brought for custom built gaming pc which has a NZXT case
customer_reviews.author: simon butler

customer_reviews.title: £120 and one fan has stopped
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, that I purchased this less than a month ago and one of the provided fans have stopped working!
customer_reviews.author: Badsey Media

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase
customer_reviews.text: The best looking cpu cooler out there for me and the noise is next to nothing , the lighting is incredible and the software accompanied by the cooler by NZXT is one of the best out there. Not only letting you change the appearance of the cooler but providing details on your whole system. thoroughly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They look awesome but can be a little tricky to fit
customer_reviews.text: Got 2. They look awesome but can be a little tricky to fit, you might need their USB expander to use more than one though. I can't recommend NZXT products enough.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good coms and excellent customer services !
customer_reviews.text: One of the fans stopped working but company sent out a replacement. Thank you. Looking good - just hope nothing else stops :)
customer_reviews.author: ManCity4Life

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware - Software needs just a few tweaks.
customer_reviews.text: This CPU AIO has been given a bad reputation however it's been great to me for a while now, only issue to note is the software at time can be a tad buggy which i hope they can resolve as it's a great looking and running AIO!
customer_reviews.author: Dan shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cooler when my previous NXZT cooler died. Does a great job of cooling my pc and looks great aesthetically too. Love the programmable options for the led lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Style and Cooling in One
customer_reviews.text: Very good AIO, keeping my overclocked Ryzen 7 2700X cooler than an air cooler at base speeds, can't recommend enough, very stylish and easy to install once you switch the Intel bracket and have a quick look at the manual. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: No good quality, not recomanding it
customer_reviews.text: Not so good as i expected. Very high cpu temps, on idle stays between60- 70-80 and on load 87-92 Not recomanding it.
customer_reviews.author: Costi Vasile

customer_reviews.title: Have experience with installing pumps
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t very clear In the instructions and also it does have the issue of haven’t to change the mounting bracket so the NZXT logo was level but otherwise it is very good
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Not the quietest... but looks ace
customer_reviews.text: if your thinking of AIO for a whisper quiet PC... then this isn't for you... there are quieter and cheaper fan heatsink out there... if your after a minimalist look to your PC, the this does the job... tidying things up
customer_reviews.author: Timothy O'Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works great, too loud.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Looks good, cools well, easy to install (thanks to thinner tubes), works with Intel, and AMD sockets. Cons: Mounting for AMD is a pain and fans are extremely loud.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Allmost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect but the usb connector on the pump needs to not be in all the way or the rgb doesn't work..
customer_reviews.author: radu ardeleanu

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: Seems to keep my Intel Extreme CPU nice and cool so far. The RGB/LED options are also ample which nicely ties up with the Obsidian 500D.
customer_reviews.author: Sphinx

customer_reviews.title: Best looking cooler I have ever seen
customer_reviews.text: Best looking cooler I have ever seen. Does a really good job cooling my i7 7700k at 5GHz. Although you need to apply your own thermal compound because the one that's preapplied is a pile of trash. I use the arctic mx-4 thermal compound and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Davvid

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler
customer_reviews.text: keeping my cpu i7 8700k under 30 degrees no load and never above 70 on load. Perfect but slightly annoying to install but its fine
customer_reviews.author: Jude Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent AIO
customer_reviews.text: So nice I bought it twice. Well, I bought one X62 and an X52. Both fantastic. Quiet, cool and good looking.
customer_reviews.author: "raulduke86"

customer_reviews.title: Good cooler
customer_reviews.text: Cools me pc well looks great but stock fans are a bit plain would recommend rgb corsair fans quiet and add a little spice to the mix
customer_reviews.author: Biggie

customer_reviews.title: You don't know that you NEED this cooler
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooler. Decided to go with it after reading reviews etc. And I regret nothing. Well packaged, comes with everything you need, even thermal paste already on. Very easy to install onto case (NZXT S340) and looks amazing. A must buy
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Llama

customer_reviews.title: You need this!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing piece of kit, dropped my i7 4790k down to 21 degrees idle and 66 degrees at 100% full load under stress testing, more than happy
customer_reviews.author: the smf

customer_reviews.title: Like all NZXT coolers I have had
customer_reviews.text: Like all NZXT coolers I have had, it would not talk to the software. Had to buy a new internal mini usb to internal usb header cable.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard M Abbott

customer_reviews.title: No thermal paste
customer_reviews.text: Came with a damaged radiator and no thermal paste....Now I need to wait another week for thermal paste to arrive. Consumer rights act 2015, Product not as described and damaged. Maybe the radiator got damaged on the way here but no thermal paste?
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Great product that works well. A few teething problems setting this up on the BIOS but when we managed it no more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: this looks amazing and temps are fantastic would recommend and the retailer ...
customer_reviews.text: this looks amazing and temps are fantastic would recommend and the retailer was also very good to deal with
customer_reviews.author: Ciaran.R

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet under load and looks unique.
customer_reviews.text: This water cooler is very different to most and looks even nicer in person than in the pictures. It's is very efficient and the Cam software is very user friendly. Although sometimes quite pricey, would recommend as it is also very good.
customer_reviews.author: Euan Mcsporran

customer_reviews.title: Performs and looks great
customer_reviews.text: My first computer installation that something hasn't gone wrong, extremely easy too install and low temperatures worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Sooo good looking
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Kraken, enough said. Having built my 2017 PC with the X52 it looks great and performs well, if its not broke dont fix it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking AIO
customer_reviews.text: Very good AIO and looks great inside my computer, easy to setup and has loads of options with the cam software for the lighting effects and temps are kept well under control when stressing or gaming on my computer.
customer_reviews.author: Stevieboyfitzy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Incredible RGB show lol. It is a very capable cooler, perhaps the CAM software could become available on linux!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooler. Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Nice cooler but the nzxt cam software lets it down. Easy to install. Great value!! 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Minesh Patel

product_meta.title: NZXT Kraken X72 360mm - All-In-One RGB CPU Liquid Cooler - CAM-Powered - Infinity Mirror Design - Performance Engineered Pump - Reinforced Extended Tubing - Aer P120mm Radiator Fan (3 Included)
product_meta.description:
Style Name:X72 360mm| Size Name:Kraken X Gen 2The all-new Kraken series features the most advanced controls ever to be included in an all-in-one liquid cooler. Through CAM’s software interface, users can fine-tune settings to ensure an optimal performance, even in the most intense gaming sessions. Everything, including the pump, radiator, and the fans, have been redesigned to bring you the greatest experience in liquid cooling, all backed by an industry-leading 6-year warranty.

BOX CONTAINS
1 x Kraken Cooler; 1 x Accessory Pack
feature_bullets: ADVANCED LIGHTING MODES: With an infinity mirror design, add amazing color and lighting to your CPU cooler for a fully dynamic lighting experience
ENGINEERED FOR PERFORMANCE: Engineered to achieve superior cooling while keeping noise levels to a minimum
MASTER YOUR CONTROL: Using CAM, manage the performance with precision and make changes quickly, using the desktop or mobile app. You can even monitor pump speed and liquid temperature.
ALL-NEW RADIATOR FANS: The Aer P radiator fans included are designed for liquid-cooling perfection; providing silent operation, durability, and powerful cooling performance
REINFORCED EXTENDED TUBING: Fine nylon sleeves are added to strengthen the rubber tubing and act as a protective layer, shielding your Kraken cooler tubes from potential damage during handling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,897 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
